title: Apply fixed-width mobile/desktop print layout fix across all reports

requirements.text: Update the global print stylesheet to force a consistent desktop-style print viewport on all devices (desktop, mobile, tablet) by locking the printed layout to a fixed width inside `@media print`.

quotes: Apply the print fix to all reports

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/index.css` under `@media print`, `html` and `body` are forced to a fixed desktop-style width (e.g., 1000px) with centered margins so mobile/tablet printing no longer triggers narrow responsive layout.
The fixed-width print override does not affect non-print (screen) rendering.
Printing from a mobile browser produces the same multi-column report layout as desktop for the Resident Profile Report, MAR Report, and ADL Report.

requirements.text: Audit all report print render paths in the UI and ensure each reportâ€™s printable root container opts into the shared print styles so the fixed-width print override applies consistently (Resident Profile Report, MAR Report, ADL Report, and any other report print views already present).

quotes: Apply the print fix to all reports

acceptanceCriteria: Each existing report print view uses a common printable root class (existing `print-profile` or a new shared class) so the global `@media print` rules apply uniformly.
No report print view relies on responsive Tailwind breakpoint classes in a way that reverts to a single-column mobile layout during printing.
From the Resident Profile page, printing the Resident Profile Report, MAR Report, and ADL Report yields consistent widths, table/grid alignment, and header spacing across desktop and mobile/tablet.

constraints: Do not modify files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (shadcn/ui components are read-only).
Do not edit any frontend paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: Adding new report types or new report data endpoints.
Changing report content/fields or backend report generation logic.
